channel.title: Reading Stuff
channel.description: Interesting stuff to read (okay and sometimes also to watch or listen ;-) found on the Internet.

item.title: DevOps: Don't destroy silos, transform them
item.description: "Destroying silos" is a clumsy solution to team isolation.

item.title: The Absolute Minimum Every Software Developer Must Know About Unicode in 2023 (Still No Excuses!)
item.description: Twenty years after Joel Spolsky's article a lot changed but UTF still has it's surprises.

item.title: Why are process gates the hellish spawn of evil you should avoid at all cost?
item.description: A common leadership mistake is process gates. What are process gates?

item.title: (Almost) Every infrastructure decision I endorse or regret after 4 years running infrastructure at a startup
item.description: This post lists some of the major decisions made.

item.title: Leadership Language Lessons from Star Trek
item.description: Picard didn't order people about. He didn't assume he knew best. He wasn't seeking glory. In his words: The Enterprise was a vehicle for his crew to better themselves and society. What a brilliant metaphor for organisations to aspire to.

item.title: Engineering’s role in Mergers & Acquisitions.
item.description: I managed the engineering team at Digg as we ran out of money, and were eventually acquired. It was an eye opening experience, and I learned a great deal about the reality and the optics of selling a company, particularly one with no money and a shrinking user base. Humbling was just the beginning. Since then, I’ve had the opportunity to evaluate a number of companies from the other side of the Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) table.

item.title: Why we at $FAMOUS_COMPANY Switched to $HYPED_TECHNOLOGY
item.description: How hyped technologies are promoted.

item.title: After 14 years in the industry, I still find programming difficult
item.description: Programming has many aspects.

item.title: My Notes on GitLab Postgres Schema Design
item.description: Notes on GitLab Postgres Schema Design.

item.title: ARCHITECTURE.md
item.description: If you maintain an open-source project, I strongly encourage you to add an ARCHITECTURE document next to README and CONTRIBUTING.

item.title: My favourite animation trick: exponential smoothing
item.description: There’s a certain simple animation thing that I’ve been using almost since I’ve ever started doing anything related to graphics.

item.title: Breaking Down Tasks
item.description: Diging into what’s going on when I break down a project into constitute tasks.

item.title: Thanks FedEx, This is Why we Keep Getting Phished
item.description: Here we are in the era of burgeoning AI-driven scams that are becoming increasingly hard for humans to identify, and FedEx is like "here, hold my beer".

item.title: The High-Risk Refactoring
item.description: Code refactoring may cost a fortune if not done right.

item.title: Alerting: Expectation vs Reality
item.description: One big consequence of dealing with alerts everyday is that your team gets numb to them.

item.title: Forming and Evolving Teams with TeamOS
item.description: We called it “TeamOS” – the set of processes and practices used to measure results, get work done, and to change process over time.

item.title: Linux Crisis Tools
item.description: When you have an outage caused by a performance issue, you don't want to lose precious time just to install the tools needed to diagnose it.

item.title: Mario meets Pareto
item.description: In situations where your utility function is unknown or uncertain the Pareto front helps you eliminate objectively all the sub-optimal options.

item.title: Postgres Locks Explorer
item.description: Different kind of Postgres locks and their relation explorable.

item.title: The UX of UUIDs
item.description: While using a standard UUID will satisfy all your security concerns, there’s a lot we can improve for our users.

item.title: A new time zone for the moon
item.description: White House directs NASA to create a new time zone for the moon.

item.title: How Prometheus Revolutionized Monitoring at SoundCloud - Björn Rabenstein - GOTO 2017
item.description: Monitoring and alerting with prometheus at SoundCloud.

item.title: Ten Years and Counting: My Affair with Microservices
item.description: Allegro's transition to Microservices.

item.title: Do you *really* need to store all that telemetry?
item.description: The perceived need of storing all possible telemetry data.

item.title: Beware! Anti-patterns in Event-Driven Architecture
item.description: Event-driven architecture has patterns and common practices that are solutions for various problems. Here are some patterns and why the might become anti-patterns in a given context.

item.title: You'll regret using natural keys
item.description: Natural keys might sound like the obvious solution in the first place.

item.title: Three Laws of Software Complexity (or: why software engineers are always grumpy)
item.description: The author posit that most software engineers are destined to wallow in unnecessary complexity due to three fundamental laws.

item.description: To get the right amount of logs is hard.

item.description: Again an article about the pitfalls of natural identifiers.
